Name: Painted Stool of Iy-neferti
Description: The painted stool belongs to a lady called Iy-Neferti, who was a member of the family of the artisan Sennedjem. It is supported by four round legs and painted in various colors. The seat is painted red and decorated with geometric lines. The name of its owner is written in hieroglyphics as "Osiris," a title given to the deceased to refer to her relationship with Osiris, the god of the dead.
